description.narrative: Protection of health and environment through elimination of retained POPs legacies and development of sustainable POPs management capacity within a sound chemicals management framework

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1. Number of new partnership mechanisms with funding for sustainable management solutions of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste at national and/or sub-national level , disaggregated by partnership type 2. Number of direct project beneficiaries. 3. Amounts of legacy of PCB and obsolete pesticides. 4. Technical procedures and practice manuals for PCB equipment holders covering registration, labelling, reporting, handling and tracking of PCB equipment in-service and as stockpiled pending elimination and as applicable to screening for cross contamination during maintenance developed and applied. 5. Development of qualified capability to treat and dispose of HW at the at Chechersk facility in Gomel Oblast and for national capability for environmentally sound management of PCB equipment. 6. Amount of currently stockpiled PCB equipment/waste and newly phased out PCB equipment shipped and eliminated. 7. Amount of OP removed from rural OP storage sites and number of rural storehouses where OPs are eliminated and sites restored. 8. Number of site assessment reports and containment/cleanup action plans with financial commitments identified for containment and clean up. 9. Legal, institutional and regulatory review of national chemicals management system with updates consistent with current sound chemicals management practice including EU legislation and regional trade agreements completed 10. Current POPs inventories (old and new POPs) updated and updated NIP prepared and submitted per country obligations. 11. Number of public awareness events, information products (including web accessible) produced on POPs and sound chemicals management, as implemented thru active NGO/Civil society partnerships. 12. . Knowledge management applied to project in response to needs and opportunities including mid-term and final evaluation findings with lessons learned extracted.

comment.narrative: 1. Institutional partnership - Inter-Agency Coordination Council on implementation of Basel, Stockholm, Rotterdam, Minamata conventions established in 2017 and operates. Engaged 26 representatives of governmental bodies, CSOs, scientific No finance partnerships on management of PCBs and OPs. 2. 700 PCB based equipment owners, 77 rural storages owners, 59 institutional stakeholders (22 ministries \ governmental entities and 37 regional entities), 5 CSOs. 3. 3,752.8t of PCB based equipment 10,174 t of OPs remaining in Belarus. 4.• PCB holders identified and general initial technical assistance provided during previous GEF/WB project • Generally good awareness of PCB issues exists with major PCB holders within formal sectors under government oversight (large majority of holders). • Limited awareness among peripheral industrial holders. • Within the national POPs inventory reporting system, annual reporting of PCBs by sector, regional and major holder in place. • International reporting current and web accessible • Survey of extent of cross contamination undertaken in GEF/WB project. • No operational screening yet established for transformer maintenance operations 5. • Chechersk facility provides basic infrastructure to host HW treatment/disposal capability • Core capital financial funding dedicated by Gomel Oblast • Feasibility studies on technology selection initiated • With the exception of secure storage at holder sites and the Chechersk facility national PCB management does not exist. 6. • 1,100 t of currently stockpiled equipment immediately available for shipping and environmentally sound disposal. • 2,602 t of PCB based equipment remaining in service • Removal of 1,937 t of PCB based equipment and waste mandated under National Program from service 7. • 1,900 t of OPs stored in 88 rural stockpile sites. • Environmental conditions on the sites are largely unassessed 8. • 5 remaining burial sites nominally monitored • Periodic excavation of Petrikov site ongoin

1. PCB phase out plan implementation support for sustainable and accelerated PCB phase out. 1.1 PCB phase out plan implementation support for sustainable and accelerated PCB phase out. 1.2 Sustainable PCB/chemicals waste management infrastructure developed and operational in Belarus 1.3 Environmentally sound elimination of present equipment PCB stockpiles and accelerated phased out equipment during the Project.
2. Elimination of Obsolete Pesticide Stocks: 2.1 Environmentally sound elimination of remaining OP storage site stockpiles. 2.2 Obsolete pesticide burial site containment.
3. Capacity Strengthening and Planning for Sound Chemicals Management 3.1 Legal, institutional and regulatory review of national chemicals management system with updates consistent with current sound chemicals management practice including EU and Eurasian Customs Union legislation. 3.2 Implementation of gender mainstreaming practices for project activities and sound chemical management initiatives generally. 3.3 Expanded national program for monitoring chemicals in the environment developed and implemented. 3.4 NIP Update prepared, endorsed and submitted in accordance with SC obligations. 3.5 Supporting public and stakeholder awareness and information exchange for measures on POPs and sound chemicals management.
4. Knowledge Management and M&E 4.1 Conducting an inception workshop 4.2 Conducting meetings of the Project Board 4.3 Carrying out the project audit/spot checks. 4.4 Services on written translation 4.5 Providing communication activities for the project 4.6 Lawyer services/Procurement specialist services

1: PCB phase out plan implementation support for sustainable and accelerated PCB phase out: 1.1 Taking into account the analysis of the experience of the Republic of Belarus, a mechanism for the environmentally sound elimination of PCB equipment determined. A list of organizations-owners of PCB equipment involved in the first stage of environmentally sound elimination of such equipment compiled. Nine agreements concluded with the owners of PCB equipment with the aim of environmentally sound elimination of about 430 tons of such equipment. An open tender announced for the selection of a contractor for the provision of services for the environmentally sound elimination of PCB equipment with a volume of about 430 tons. An agreement signed between the Ministry of Natural Resources and Republican Scientific Research Unitary Enterprise Bel SIC Ecology for the provision of services for the development of a methodology and assessment of possible cross-contamination of electrical equipment that does not contain polychlorinated biphenyls. A Methodology for assessing possible cross-contamination of electrical equipment that does not contain polychlorinated biphenyls developed. 1.3 Tender documentation was prepared for the provision of services for the removal and environmentally sound destruction of existing stocks of PCB equipment (about 430 tons). An open tender announced.
2: Elimination of Obsolete Pesticide Stocks: 2.1 An open tender was held for the provision of services for the environmentally sound destruction of obsolete pesticides with a total volume of about 700 tons stored in the warehouses of agricultural organizations in the Vitebsk and Grodno regions. By now, contracts are being signed between the Ministry of Natural Resources (customer of services), waste owners, and Geocoma Sp.z o.o. Sp.k. (service provider). According to the agreement, in 2021, the specified volume of hazardous waste will be removed from the Republic of Belarus. Preparatory work has begun on the organization of environmentally sound destruction of obsolete pesticides (about 500 tons) stored in the warehouses of agricultural organizations in the Minsk region. 2.2 Terms of reference for the Petrikovsky burial of obsolete pesticides prepared.
3. Capacity Strengthening and Planning for Sound Chemicals Management 3.1 Taking into account that the Ministry of Health is responsible for the regulation of chemicals, interaction with the Ministry has been organized to formulate approaches to the development of an integrated management system for chemicals, in view of the current policy of the Republic of Belarus. 3.2 Information materials were published on raising awareness of the population, especially women, about POPs. Through the committees of natural resources and environmental protection of the Republic of Belarus, information materials were brought to the public. 3.3 Terms of reference for the provision of services for the modernization of the Unified POPs database, including services for automating the processing of state statistical reports 1-Waste of the Ministry of Natural Resources, as a data source for the Unified POPs database prepared. The first editions of state standards for monitoring POPs in environmental components including water and soil developed. A specification for the purchase of laboratory analytical equipment and auxiliary materials developed and agreed by the Project Board. The State Institution Republican Center for Analytical Control in the Field of Environmental Protection was identified by the Project Board as the recipient of this equipment. 3.4 The national expert of the project has prepared a draft National Plan for the fulfillment of obligations assumed by the Republic of Belarus to implement the provisions of the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants. A working group created, including representatives of interested ministries, departments and public organizations (15 organizations). The developed draft National Plan for the fulfillment of the obligations assumed by the Republic of Belarus on the implementation of the provisions of the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants was considered at an online meeting by the members of the Working Group. Taking into account the proposals of the members of the working group, the final draft of the National Plan for the Implementation of the obligations adopted by the Republic of Belarus to implement the provisions of the Stockholm Convention on persistent organic pollutants for 2021 - 2025 was prepared, which will be included in subprogram 3 Management of persistent organic pollutants of the State Program Environmental Protection and Sustainable Use of Natural Resources for 2021 - 2025. 3.5 Information materials were prepared explaining the importance of the POPs problem for women, children, workers of agricultural organizations, workers of industrial organizations. These information materials are disseminated to the target audience through the Committees of Natural Resources and Environmental Protection. The website http://soz.minpriroda.gov.by/ has been updated, which covers issues related to POPs and information on the projects activities. A forum has been created on the site through which you can discuss issues related to the impact of POPs on human health. Agreements have been reached with the public associations Green Economy and Environmental Initiative to hold a joint seminar on the impact of POPs on the environment and human health.
4. Knowledge Management and M&E. 4.1 The inception workshop held. The draft inception report prepared. 4.2 5 meetings of the Project Board held. 4.3 Recommendations based on the results of the audit of the financial activities of the Ministry of Natural Resources, aimed at the implementation of the project, were taken into account in the subsequent implementation of the project. 4.4 Translation services are provided by the State Institution “Republican Center for Analytical Control in the Field of Environmental Protection” properly and on time. 4.5 Information about the implementation of the project is posted on the Internet sites: soz.minpriroda.gov.by minpriroda.gov.by The publication on the implementation of the project was published in the newspaper Zvyazda (issue of 11/17/2020). The Postavy TV channel has published a news report about the Project. Project staff took part in a press conference on the topic: Prevention of the harmful effects of persistent organic pollutants on the environment and health of citizens , which took place on September 15, 2020 at the Press Center of the House of Press. The PR manager of the project is responsible for the overall coordination of communications within the project. 4.6 29 procurement procedures were carried out, as a result of which 19 contracts for the provision of services and the supply of goods were concluded. Procurement specialist services are provided as appropriate. The services of a lawyer were provided from April 1, 2020 to July 31, 2020.
The project was registered in the end of 2018 and no activities in 2019.
The project was registered in the end of 2018 and no activities in 2019.
